title: Arabian Courtyard Hotel & Spa holds another successful Biryani MuqablaTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Arabian Courtyard Hotel & Spa holds another successful Biryani Muqabla  
Arabian Courtyard Hotel & Spa, located in the heart of the ancient cultural district of Dubai, recently hosted the 9th Annual Biryani Muqabala, a live cooking competition sponsored by award winning Mumtaz Mahal Restaurant.
 
Ms Nabila Waqar was declared top winner with her entry of Maan Pasand Biryani dish followed by Zareen Ahmed and Jharna Prakash Alwani as runners-up. The winning recipes will be featured as a Mumtaz Mahal Restaurant special menu and diners will have a chance to taste the delectable dish.
 
The Judges for the contest were renowned food critics, writer and chef namely Ms Hannah Joji- food blogger,Mr Rakesh Puri, CEO of Sterling Perfumes and Cook Book writer, Fatma Tas- food blogger and Chef. Glen Ferdinand, Executive Chef of Arabian Courtyard Hotel & Spa, who selected the top three winners from the 09 chosen candidates out of 250 entries forms received This year’s winning recipe is Maan Pasand Biryani which will be part of award-winning Mumtaz Mahal restaurant menu, followed by Chicken Charga Biryani and Veg Methi Muttur Biryani.
 
Habib Khan, General Manager of Arabian Courtyard Hotel & Spa, said “We are delighted to hold this special event and warmly congratulate the participants and the winners. The creativity and dedication observed by these participants while cooking is remarkable and according to me all of them are the winners. We started this contest 9 years ago with an aim to reach out to all the aspiring chefs especially house wives and people who take pride in exhibiting their culinary skills to a larger audience. We are proud to say that every year the magnitude of the contest is growing and exceeding our expectations with a record number of entries for participation.”
 
Source:-Arabian Courtyard Hotel
